How to Perform a Drag and Drop Web Capture in Adobe Acrobat 
 Home Random Browse Articles Notifications Add to This Page Add Tip Easy Ways to Help Approve Questions Review Tech Feedback Fix Spelling More Things to Try...   
 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Talk How to Perform a Drag and Drop Web Capture in Adobe Acrobat   
 Adobe Acrobat 6 Professional enables you to convert a web page to a PDF document with a simple drag-and-drop operation. 
 Steps Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ed\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ed\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Close all open files in Acrobat. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/74\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/74\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 In your Web browser, access the web page you want to convert. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":348.15934065934,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":575.21978021978} 
 3 
 From the Address bar on your Web browser, drag the icon for the Web page onto the Acrobat icon on the Windows task bar. 
While dragging, the pointer displays a shortcut icon underneath the arrowhead.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4c\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-4-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4c\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-4-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Hold the shortcut icon over the Acrobat icon on the taskbar until the Acrobat window is active and is displayed in the foreground. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/83\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/83\/Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Perform-a-Drag-and-Drop-Web-Capture-in-Adobe-Acrobat-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Drag the shortcut icon onto the Acrobat window, and release the pointer in the empty document area of the Acrobat window. 
Acrobat converts the web page into a PDF document.
